original_solution_mapping.L1: If two pizzas will be delivered at two of the stops, the total number of stops will be 12-2=<<12-2=10>>10 stops.
original_solution_mapping.L2: If there are 10 stops in 40 minutes, then the delivery person needs to average 40/10=<<40/10=4>>4 minutes per stop.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4671.
    Returns: the average minutes per stop the delivery person needs.
    """
    # L1
    initial_potential_stops = 12 # 12 pizzas to deliver
    stops_consolidated = 2 # two of the stops are for orders of two pizzas
    total_stops = initial_potential_stops - stops_consolidated

    # L2
    total_delivery_time = 40 # deliver all of the pizzas in 40 minutes
    minutes_per_stop_average = total_delivery_time / total_stops

    # FA
    answer = minutes_per_stop_average
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If two pizzas will be delivered at two of the stops, the total number of stops will be {initial_potential_stops}-{stops_consolidated}=<<{initial_potential_stops}-{stops_consolidated}={total_stops}>>{total_stops} stops.

If there are {total_stops} stops in {total_delivery_time} minutes, then the delivery person needs to average {total_delivery_time}/{total_stops}=<<{total_delivery_time}/{total_stops}={minutes_per_stop_average}>>{minutes_per_stop_average} minutes per stop.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If two pizzas will be delivered at two of the stops, the total number of stops will be 12-2=<<12-2=10>>10 stops.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If there are 10 stops in 40 minutes, then the delivery person needs to average 40/10=<<40/10=400>>400 minutes per stop.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
